1.brief: to tend a flock; i.e. pasture it; intransitively, to graze (literally or figuratively); generally to rule; by extension, to associate with (as a friend)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
to broaden out the ear (with the hand), i.e. (by implication) to listen
to drive forth (a person, an animal or chariot), i.e. lead, carry away; reflexively, to proceed (i.e. impel or guide oneself); also (from the panting induced by effort), to sigh
a collective name for a flock (of sheep or goats); also figuratively (of men)
Joseph, the name of seven Israelites
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry

2.brief: the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
Ephrajim, a son of Joseph; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory
Binjamin, youngest son of Jacob; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory
Menashsheh, a grandson of Jacob, also the tribe descended from him, and its territory
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
force (literally or figuratively); by implication, valor, victory
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
something saved, i.e. (abstractly) deliverance; hence, aid, victory, prosperity

3.brief: gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
to be (causative, make) luminous (literally and metaphorically)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor

4.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
properly, extent (of time); but used only adverbially (especially with other particle prefixes), when (either relative or interrogative)
to smoke, whether literal or figurative
intercession, supplication; by implication, a hymn
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock

5.brief: food (for man or beast), especially bread, or grain (for making it)
to quaff, i.e. (causatively) to irrigate or furnish apotion to

a triple, i.e. (as a musical instrument) a triangle (or perhaps rather threestringed lute); also (as an indefinite, great quantity) a three-fold measure (perhaps a treble ephah); also (as an officer) a general of the third rank (upward, i.e. the highest)

6.brief: to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
a resident; by extension, a fellow-citizen
to deride; by implication (as if imitating a foreigner) to speak unintelligibly

7.brief: gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
to be (causative, make) luminous (literally and metaphorically)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor

8.brief: a vine (as twining), especially the grape
Mitsrajim, i.e. Upper and Lower Egypt
properly, to pull up, especially the tent-pins, i.e. start on ajourney
to drive out from a possession; especially to expatriate or divorce
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
properly, to strike in, i.e. fix; specifically, to plant (literally or figuratively)

9.brief: to turn; by implication, to face, i.e. appear, look, etc.
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
to root, i.e. strike into the soil, or (by implication) to pluck from it
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

10.brief: properly, to plump, i.e. fill up hollows; by implication, to cover (for clothing or secrecy)
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
a cedar tree (from the tenacity of its roots)
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)

11.brief: to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
severed, i.e. harvest (as reaped), the crop, the time, the reaper, or figuratively; also a limb (of a tree, or simply foliage)
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south
near, with or among; often in general, to
a stream (including the sea; expectation the Nile, Euphrates, etc.); figuratively, prosperity

12.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to break out (in many applications, direct and indirect, literal and figurative)
a circumvallation; by implication, an inclosure
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb

13.brief: a copse of bushes; hence, a forest; hence, honey in the comb (as hived in trees)
fulness of the breast; also a moving creature
to tend a flock; i.e. pasture it; intransitively, to graze (literally or figuratively); generally to rule; by extension, to associate with (as a friend)

14.brief: gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
'I pray', 'now', or 'then'; added mostly to verbs (in the Imperative or Future), or to interjections, occasionally to an adverb or conjunction
to scan, i.e. look intently at; by implication, to regard with pleasure, favor or care
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
to visit (with friendly or hostile intent); by analogy, to oversee, muster, charge, care for, miss, deposit, etc.
a vine (as twining), especially the grape

15.brief: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
properly, to strike in, i.e. fix; specifically, to plant (literally or figuratively)
the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
to be alert, physically (on foot) or mentally (in courage)

16.brief: the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)

17.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
to be alert, physically (on foot) or mentally (in courage)

18.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to flinch, i.e. (by implication) to go back, literally (to retreat) or figuratively (to apostatize)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
to live, whether literally or figuratively; causatively, to revive
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)

19.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
to be (causative, make) luminous (literally and metaphorically)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor
